description.en: The course will focus on describing various fermentation technologies for microbial and mammalian cells used in research and industrial context. Lectures will include the following subjects: introduction to metabolism, stoichiometry, industrial media, mass balances and kinetics of cultivation processes, bioreactors and accessories, microbial cell factories and strain improvement, mammalian cell factories, mass transport and industrial fermentation processes. Industry Practice Possibility in Lallemand and TF TAK, TalTech.

objectives.en: Give a theoretical and practical knowledge on the main cultivation technologies and demonstrate their applications, both, in research and industrial bioprocess optimization.

learning_outcomes.en:
Theoretical knowledge on:
*	introduction to metabolism, stoichiometry, 
*	industrial media, 
*	mass balances and kinetics of cultivation processes,
*	bioreactors and accessories,
*	microbial cell factories and strain improvement, 
*	mammalian cell factories, 
*	mass transport, and 
*	industrial fermentation processes.

Practical knowledge on:
*	Cultivation of lactic acid bacteria in batch cultures,
*	Cultivation of yeast in fed-batch conditions,
*	Cultivation of E. coli in continuous cultures."

description.et:
practical excercises (leading person - Kaarel Adamberg, assistant persons - Regina Maruste and Lorena Azevedo de Lima, detailed plan in the Table 1)
Data analysis (Kaarel Adamberg)
examination (Kaarel Adamberg). During examination each group make presentation  about their practical work and calculations. 
Practical work is dividid into seven different stages: 
i)	setup of fermentation system,
ii)	preparation of culture medium, 
iii)	batch cultivation, 
iv)	chemostat cultivation,
v)	decelerostat cultivation (De-stat),
vi)	fed-batch with desired specific growth rate (u-stat)
vii)	cleaning and decontamination
In the course will be four groups, three students in each group. All groups are carrying out the same experiment, excluding temperature, which is varied within groups.  Group 1 is working with fermenter 1 etc.
